com.layar.sdk

Class LayarSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.layar.sdk.LayarSDK

  • public final class LayarSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    The Layar SDK allows you to integrate the Layar AR view in your own application. This class offers methods to initialize and launch the Layar SDK Activities.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(Context context,
              java.lang.String oauthKey,
              java.lang.String oauthSecret)
        Initialize the Layar SDK with the specified OAuth credentials. This will prepare the Layar SDK for use, including initializing any data managers used by Layar. This method must be called before any other interaction with the Layar SDK.

        The OAuth credentials are needed to authenticate the application using the Layar SDK, and are tied to your publisher account at Layar.

        Parameters:
        context - the Android context to use for hooking up the SDK
        oauthKey - the OAuth key to use for signing the requests to the Layar servers
        oauthSecret - the OAuth secret to use for signing the requests to the Layar servers

      • startLayarActivity

        public static void startLayarActivity(Context context)
        Start the Layar Activity in scan mode. This activity can be used by the user to scan magazine pages, posters, etc. (the search is limited to the images from the campaigns published under your publishers account). The SDK will take care of the display of the digital content from your campains.

        Note: before this method is called you must have initialized the SDK properly using the initialize method.

        The scan view will only return content tied to your publisher account.

        Parameters:
        context - the Android Context to use for launching the Layar Activity

      • startLayarActivity

        public static void startLayarActivity(Context context,
                      java.lang.String layerName)
        Start the Layar Activity and open the specified layer. When the layer is a geo layer, the SDK will switch to geo mode and will show the content around the user. When the layer is a vision layer, the contents of the campaign are preloaded.

        Note: before this method is called you must have initialized the SDK properly using the initialize method.

        The Layar SDK will only be able to access layers tied to your publisher account.

        Parameters:
        context - the Android Context to use for launching the Layar Activity
        layerName - the unique layer name of the layer to open

      • startLayarActivity

        public static void startLayarActivity(Context context,
                      LayarSDKClient sdkClient)
        Start the Layar Activity in scan mode with a custom LayarSDKClient implementation. This activity can be used by the user to scan magazine pages, posters, etc. (the search is limited to the images from the campaigns published under your publishers account). The SDK will take care of the display of the digital content from your campains.

        The LayarSDKClient will be used for event callbacks that allow your application to have insight and control over certain parts of the Layar SDK flow.

        Note: before this method is called you must have initialized the SDK properly using the initialize method.

        The scan view will only return content tied to your publisher account.

        Parameters:
        context - the Android Context to use for launching the Layar Activity
        sdkClient - the SDK client class that should receive event based callbacks to control and customize the flow

      • startLayarActivity

        public static void startLayarActivity(Context context,
                      LayarSDKClient sdkClient,
                      java.lang.String layerName)
        Start the Layar Activity with a custom LayarSDKClient implementation and open the specified layer. When the layer is a geo layer, the SDK will switch to geo mode and will show the content around the user. When the layer is a vision layer, the contents of the campaign are preloaded.

        The LayarSDKClient will be used for event callbacks that allow your application to have insight and control over certain parts of the Layar SDK flow.

        Note: before this method is called you must have initialized the SDK properly using the initialize method.

        The Layar SDK will only be able to access layers tied to your publisher account.

        Parameters:
        context - the Android Context to use for launching the Layar Activity
        sdkClient - the SDK client class that should receive event based callbacks to control and customize the flow
        layerName - the unique layer name of the layer to open
